lead_paragraph: Brian Savage retired from the N.H.L. yesterday after a 12-year career that included stops in Montreal, Phoenix, St. Louis and Philadelphia. Savage, 35, appeared in 647 regular-season games, recording 192 goals and 167 assists for 359 points. He played at Miami of Ohio and was selected by the Canadiens in the eighth round of the 1991 draft. Savage won a silver medal at the 1994 Olympics as part of Canada’s team. He also played for Canada at the 1993 and 1999 world championships. He had his best season in 1996-97, when he had 60 points on 23 goals and 37 assists in 81 games for Montreal.
